creator: anisle@orgio.net
text:
first of all, i'm not good at english. (sorry for this.)
i use fedora core1. with apache 1.3.29, php 4.3.4.
once i tried to attach mod_python to apache, but i failed.
from then, the problem occured.
usually, i use two web browers : mozilla firebird 0.7 and IE.
with IE, php files on my server are correctly loaded.
but with mozilla firedbird 0.7, they were not.
so, i installed mozilla 1.6 and loaded same page again, it worked.
but, on the other pc, every web browser loaded that page correctly.

to summarize my problem.

i try to load :
somephpfile.php

on PC A (my PC):
mozilla 1.6 and IE 6.0 loads that page. but firebird does not(it tries to
download that phpfile)

on PC B (another PC):
every web browser loads that page correctly.


i am not sure that which part (the clients, and the server) has the problem, but
i thought i should report this problem here.


sorry for my poor english again :-(

ps. if you need to contact me, please send me a mail to: minnysunny at email dot it

thanks for your concern.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
I think, a look at the headers may help. Please install the live http headers
plugin for firebird and post here, what it puts out.
No response from submitter.  Assuming invalid.
creator: slive@apache.org
